item.title: Poisson processes
item.description: 1 Prelude: Bernoulli process A Bernoulli process is a sequence \(\{Z_n\}_{n \ge 1}\) of i.i.d. binary random variables. Let \(p = \PR(Z_n = 1)\) and \(q = 1 - p = \PR(Z_n = 0)\). An example would be i.i.d. coin tosses where we can think of \(\{Z_n = 1\}\) as the event that the \(h\)-th outcome is a head and \(\{Z_n = 0\}\) to be the event that the \(n\)-th outcome is a tail.
